articles.author: Aristos Georgiou
articles.title: 480,000-year-old ax sharpener is the oldest known elephant bone tool ever discovered in Europe - Live Science
articles.description: The "very rare" find provides an extraordinary glimpse into the ingenuity of early human relatives who lived around half a million years ago.
articles.content:
A triangular artifact crafted from elephant bone was used by archaic human relatives to sharpen hand axes around 480,000 years ago in what is now the U.K., a new analysis reveals.
